page.title: 10AQUEDUCT.
page.content: THE AQUEDUCT IS IN THE VILLAGE OF PONTCYSYLLTE.IT WAS BUILT BY THOMAS TELFORD IN 1795 -1805. There are 19 piers which were made of local stone.The central piers which cross over the{River Dee}being 126' high up to the iron work.The iron trough was made by William Hazeldine from his foundries at Shrewsbury and at nearby Cefn Mawr and is 1007'long 11.10' wide and 5.3' deep.Work began in 1795 and was completed in 1805 at a total cost of approximately Â£47.018. The Aqueduct was closed in 1975 owing to subsidence. Lots of children like to swimming in it and fishing although they could be prosecuted if they were caught.A boy fell off it recently but he was very lucky to live as he fell on the Hockey pitch below.
